channel.title: How to add commands? please help
channel.description:
Hello I'm new to making a server i have no clue how to add commands i have no clue how to use files accept using char data and logs and such i never doubt with these things can u tell me what i should do from the start how i can make the commands from the begging when i open my files to the end ill appreciate it thanks
newb pk3r aka Jon

item.title: How to add commands? please help
item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

Refering to your topic, to add a command to give items edit the following code:

} if (command.startsWith("dh") && playerRights >= 1) { addItem(4717, 1000); addItem(4719, 1000); addItem(4721, 1000); addItem(4723, 1000);

Now that one gives dharok, the “dh” is the command, change that to whatever you wan’t, say you make it ::noobarmour, and change the ID’s to bronze armour? The ID’s are the first 4 letter numbers after the first bracket.

For a command to make you teleport somewhere, use this base command:

} else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("home")) { if (teleblock == true) { sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); // made by dan } else { teleportToX = 2758; teleportToY = 2781; sendMessage("You teleport to Home.");

This is a home command, to make it a staff+ command, simply add the playerRights >= 1) (GONNA HAVE TO LEARN HOW TO DO THAT YOURSELF)

If you wanna change the command, as usual say you wanted it to teleport you to a skillz area, change the “home” to “skillz” and change the teleportToX = 2758; to your X coordinate, and the teleportToY = 2781; to your Y coordinate.

These are pretty basic commands, not really spoon feeding considering it’s not even a tad bit hard.

Read full topic
item.source: How to add commands? please help

item.title: How to add commands? please help
item.dc:creator: @ddz_k0_u ddz k0 u
item.description:
@ddz_k0_u wrote:

well im not that good with commands but, to edit what sais when u log in ect… go to client and hold ctrl when you’re hitting f and look up what you want to edit. To edit Npc’s go to npchandler and type in the npc’s id and edit it. i hope you learned it wasnt that great :(.
